# IGAD Innovation Hub - General Context
## Overview
IGAD Innovation Hub is a regional AI-powered digital platform designed to enhance coordination, knowledge sharing, and innovation across governments, NGOs, and research institutions in the Horn of Africa.
## Core Terminals
The hub is structured around five core terminals:
- **IGAD Report Generator** - **IGAD Policy Analyzer** - **IGAD Proposal Writer** *(MVP priority)* - **IGAD Newsletter** *(MVP priority)* - **IGAD Agribusiness**
## Platform Architecture
The platform's core engine (AI assistant) connects to the **IGAD Knowledge Network (IGAD-KN)**, which scans IGAD-related sources for up-to-date data and insights:
- ICPAC - CEWARN - IDDRSI - Other IGAD sources
## Design Principles
The design follows Glashaus Innovation's recommendations for a human-centered, safe, and collaborative AI experience:
- Feedback loops - Transparency - Prompt augmentation to guide non-expert users
## Design Resources
[Figma mockups](https://riff-break-95216508.figma.site) illustrate the envisioned interface, including:
- Login interface - Dashboard - User terminals
## MVP Development Focus
The immediate development focus is on two core terminals:
1. **Proposal Writer** 2. **Newsletter**
Each terminal includes: - Detailed "Jobs to Be Done" specifications - Behavioral prompts - Service ideas already defined

IGAD Innovation Hub V2 (MVP Technical Specification) Engine Context: Amazon Q + awslabscode-doc-gen-mcp-server (AWS Labs Code Documentation Generator)
---------------------------------------------------------------------- GOAL ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Create a comprehensive Technical Specification Document for the IGAD Innovation Hub (MVP), focusing on simplicity, modular scalability, and cost-efficient design.
The specification must describe: • Technical architecture, APIs, data models, workflows, and AI integration. • AWS Serverless implementation using React (frontend), Python (backend via Lambda), and DynamoDB (database). • Integration with IGAD Knowledge Network (IGAD-KN) for AI-assisted data ingestion and generation.
The MVP includes: 1. Transversal Components: Login, Home Page, Global Navigation Bar, prompts manager. 2. Functional Modules: Proposal Writer, Newsletter Generator. 3. Integration Layer: IGAD AI Assistant connected to IGAD-KN.
Guiding principle: “La simplicidad es la máxima sofisticación.” Keep all design decisions minimal, elegant, and maintainable.
---------------------------------------------------------------------- OUTPUT ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Generate a structured technical specification in Markdown following AWS documentation standards.
Each section must be detailed and implementation-ready for engineering teams.
Sections: 1. Overview - Purpose, objectives, MVP scope, and user roles. - Guiding principles and simplicity rationale.
2. Architecture - AWS Serverless high-level diagram: API Gateway, Lambda, S3, DynamoDB, Cognito. - Frontend-backend-data interaction overview. - Integration model with IGAD-KN AI service layer.
3. Component Specifications - Auth, Core Services, Proposal Writer, Newsletter. - Transversal UI components: Login, Home, Navbar. - Internal dependencies and communication flows.
4. Data Flow & Workflows - Authentication sequence, proposal creation flow, newsletter personalization. - Event-driven data processing and caching.
5. APIs & Endpoints - RESTful API definitions (methods, parameters, responses, errors). - Authentication headers and error codes.
6. Data Models - DynamoDB table schemas (keys, attributes, indexes). - Entity relationships and scalability design.
7. AI Integration - Prompt orchestration, validation layers, and AI response handling. - IGAD-KN data ingestion pipeline and knowledge retrieval.
8. Security & Compliance - IAM roles, Cognito user pool setup, encryption, monitoring. - Compliance with AWS best practices for identity and logging.
9. Environment & Dependencies - Required AWS services, SDKs, frameworks, CI/CD setup (CodePipeline, Amplify).
10. Scalability & Cost Optimization - Lambda scaling policies, DynamoDB capacity management, cost control mechanisms.
11. Extensibility Plan - Architecture hooks for future modules: Policy Analyzer, Report Generator, Agribusiness. - Version control and modular expansion guidance.
---------------------------------------------------------------------- LIMITS ---------------------------------------------------------------------- - Use only AWS-managed services. - Avoid over-engineering; focus on MVP deliverables. - Maintain cost-efficiency and scalability balance. - Do not include placeholder content unrelated to MVP.
---------------------------------------------------------------------- DATA ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Reference materials: • IGAD Innovation Hub Product Profile (030925_V1) • INTERNAL IGAD IH Overview (20250917) • Figma Mockups: https://riff-break-95216508.figma.site
Use for UI logic, user roles, naming conventions, and layout consistency.
---------------------------------------------------------------------- EVALUATION ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Amazon Q output (via awslabscode-doc-gen-mcp-server) will be evaluated for: 1. Technical completeness (architecture, data, security, AI). 2. Implementation readiness for developers. 3. Alignment with AWS Serverless best practices. 4. Simplicity and maintainability. 5. Cost optimization through pay-per-execution design.
---------------------------------------------------------------------- PARTITIONING STRATEGY ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Output must be modularized into the following Markdown documents:
1. specs/architecture/overview.md — Project summary, principles, and MVP context. 2. specs/architecture/architecture.md — Serverless design, diagrams, components. 3. specs/architecture/components.md — Module-level specifications and dependencies. 4. specs/architecture/dataflows.md — Workflow and process documentation. 5. specs/architecture/api-specs.md — RESTful endpoint definitions and schemas. 6. specs/architecture/data-models.md — DynamoDB schema documentation. 7. specs/architecture/ai-integration.md — IGAD AI assistant and IGAD-KN interface. 8. specs/architecture/security.md — IAM, encryption, and compliance. 9. specs/architecture/environment.md — Dependencies and CI/CD setup. 10.specs/architecture/scalability.md — Scaling, optimization, and cost considerations. 11.specs/architecture/extensibility.md — Future modules and roadmap guidance.
Each file must contain full context without dependency on other files. Cross-references should be expressed as relative links.

# Commit Nomenclature Rules
## Mandatory Format ``` <type>: <description>
[optional body]
[optional footer] ```
## Commit Types (REQUIRED)
### Primary Types - **feat**: New feature or functionality - **fix**: Bug fix or error correction - **docs**: Documentation changes only - **style**: Code formatting, missing semicolons (no logic change) - **refactor**: Code restructuring without changing functionality - **test**: Adding or updating tests - **chore**: Maintenance tasks, dependencies, build process
### Secondary Types - **perf**: Performance improvements - **ci**: CI/CD pipeline changes - **build**: Build system or external dependencies - **revert**: Reverting previous commits
## Description Rules
### Format Requirements - **Lowercase**: Start with lowercase letter - **Imperative mood**: "add feature" not "added feature" - **No period**: Don't end with a period - **Max 50 characters**: Keep it concise - **Present tense**: "fix bug" not "fixed bug"
### Examples ```bash ✅ GOOD: feat: add user authentication system fix: resolve database connection timeout docs: update API documentation refactor: simplify payment processing logic test: add unit tests for user service chore: update dependencies to latest versions
❌ BAD: Added new feature Fixed a bug Update docs Refactoring code Various changes WIP ```
## Multi-line Format
### With Body ``` feat: add user authentication system
- Implement JWT token validation - Add login/logout endpoints - Create user session management - Update security middleware ```
### With Footer ``` fix: resolve database connection timeout
Closes #123 Fixes #456 ```
## Scope (Optional) ``` feat(auth): add JWT token validation fix(api): resolve timeout issues docs(readme): update installation guide ```
## Breaking Changes ``` feat!: redesign user authentication API
BREAKING CHANGE: Authentication endpoints now require API key ```
## Amazon Q Automation Rules
### Pre-commit Validation - Amazon Q MUST validate commit message format before executing `git commit` - Reject commits that don't follow the nomenclature - Suggest corrections for invalid formats
### Auto-generated Messages When Amazon Q creates commits, use this format: ``` <type>: <component> <action> completed by Amazon Q
- Sprint X: <specific changes> - Updated: <files modified> - Status: <completion status> ```
## Enforcement
### Git Hooks (Optional) Create `.git/hooks/commit-msg` to validate format: ```bash #!/bin/sh commit_regex='^(feat|fix|docs|style|refactor|test|chore|perf|ci|build|revert)(\(.+\))?: .{1,50}' if ! grep -qE "$commit_regex" "$1"; then echo "Invalid commit message format!" echo "Use: <type>: <description>" exit 1 fi ```
### IDE Integration - Configure IDE to show commit message template - Use commit message validation plugins - Set up pre-commit hooks for automatic validation
## Quick Reference
### Most Common Patterns ```bash feat: add new dashboard component fix: resolve API endpoint error docs: update deployment guide refactor: optimize database queries test: add integration tests chore: update package dependencies ```
### Sprint Commits by Amazon Q ```bash feat: Sprint 1 infrastructure setup completed by Amazon Q fix: Sprint 2 database connection issues resolved by Amazon Q docs: Sprint 3 API documentation generated by Amazon Q ```
